Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: raybrahms1964
Reviews.Content: Ok, let's get real. For a budget hotel near the centre of Amsterdam, this does exactly what it says on the tin. The owners were very polite, the breakfast was sufficient (cold meats, cheese, rolls, toast, cereal, boiled eggs) and the room was clean. It was everything we expected and great for a base to explore Amsterdam. Everywhere is only a tram ride away and we had no complaints at all. If you're looking for luxury you won't find it here, but it suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, good location, but the blocked on my card money (hotel's guarantee) is not unlocked yet (20 days gone)

Reviews.Title: “What you need you get.”
Reviews.Author: Kingbuff
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a little run-down, seeing as this hotel is almost packed solid nonstop. ItÂ´s cheap and itÂ´s in the city centre. What more do you want in Amsterdam, youÂ´re not spending a lot of time in your hotel room. If you plan to, choose a different hotel, spend the extra 30 bucks. I had a single with shared bathroom-shower. At least I had my own sink. The room was cleanish but it was really worn down. It did have a wall-mounted flat-screen tv though, 12inch. The toilet didnÂ´t flush well but thatÂ´s common in old houses in Amsterdam. Also, the walls are a bit flimsy, I could tell the couple next door was probably having some weird argument as she kept agreeing with him louder and louder ;) Breakfast was minimal but decent. Assorted condiments and some cheese/ham/salami. I would stay again. ItÂ´s cheap by Amsterdam standards and itÂ´s located near the Amstel rivier, just outside the Prinsengracht, so it has a pretty decent location. DonÂ´t stay there if youÂ´re expecting to have a top-notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value 2* in a brilliant locations”
Reviews.Author: Manda_and_Gaz
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel for budget travellers in Amsterdam but excellent choice. Very clean, we had a double with private facilities for 4 nights, they changed the towels 3 times whilst we were there. Breakfast was a good choice although a bit busy at peak times! The hotel is in a fantastic area, very chic neighbourhood with lovely shops, coffee houses (not shops!), restaurants etc. Only about 10-15 minutes walk into the centre of Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay for budget-minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: mbalass
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean place to simply rest your head at nighttime and don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room, this hotel is a good option. It's reasonably close to the entertainment options in Central Amsterstam, i.e. a 10-15 minute walk to Dam Square and surrounded by lots of shops and restaurants. The biggest pro is definitely the location if you don't mind some healthy walking or biking to get around, which you'd have to do anyway. The customer service is good, the staff were nice and helpful. The free breakfast was much appreciated as well. The condition of the room and the lobby area has room for improvement. When we walked into the rather shabby lobby which doubles as the eating area, there was an unpleasant smell and it was certainly not what we expected the lobby to look like. Our room was located in the building next to the lobby and there is a set of very steep and narrow stairs to climb to get into the building. The room itself was very basic and small, no frills at all, but that was to be expected. Reasonably clean except some mildew in the bathroom. It would have been nice if the TV worked better, it was all scrambled.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonable value, decent location, clean.”
Reviews.Author: andiLG
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a location that allows easy acess to trams and reasonable walk to many landmarks. It is not fancy but clean. The price was not cheap but probably good value in comparison to other options. The back patio should be cleaned up to provide an additional comfortable area for guests.

Reviews.Title: “sweet, quiet little hotel next to one of Amsterdamâ€™s few parks”
Reviews.Author: BigCloits
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Hotel de Munck because it was the only place in the city that had a room for us, and so we were slightly concerned about what we would get. Fortunately, it turned out to be an amazingly sweet, decent little place for the low rate. Service was friendly and cleanliness was excellent. The included breakfast was humble and basic but perfectly good. Free wifi was thankfully there and very handy (but not advertised on the website). It is directly across the street from a small park, one of the only parks in the city. An excellent coffee shop (Two For Joy) next door, and a grocery store in the same block are great conveniences. The location within the city overall is great: still in central Amsterdam, just far enough from the centre to be a bit quieter, especially at night, but still extremely close to major attractions. When we saw other hotels weâ€™d tried to book, we thought, â€œPhew, glad we didnâ€™t end up there: too urban and noisy!â€� We had some minor quibbles, but all things that are just part of staying in a cheaper hotel in the heart of Amsterdam: for instance, noise from guests coming and going on creaky and noisy old doors was a bit hard to sleep through at times. And the park across the street feels just a little dodgy for a timid tourist after dark, with some local youth often hanging out and talking noisily, particularly favouring a small area directly in front of the hotel: a minor concern, but a bit unfortunate. And the free wifi, although it was great to have anything at all, was quite unreliable in the rooms: too far from a single router in the lobby, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked Away Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: BaptisteLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location- a short tram ride from centraal station. If you're looking for a Cosy place away from the crowd (but not too far away) this is the place for you! It's quiet but too not quiet, busy but not too bustling. Looked after our handluggage no problem whilst we waited a few hours for our room to be ready and on our last day before we flew home (nothing worse than having to lug round your rucksack everywhere!) Owners welcoming but not intrusive, helpful and organised. Breakfasts-simple but just right. All in all, perfect little place for people that can climb steep steps up to their room (completely normal for Amsterdam), who want to explore the city. Go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small butique hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Dawnrose
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Munck near the centrum, at great prices. Hotel owner and reception was friendly checking up on the needs of their visitors. Mostly smiling.. Like all locals of Amsterdam, they spoke perfect English. If you need anything to be arranged, make sure to ask during the morning / breakfast hours, as there is no one later to call a taxi or anything. Luckily, a taxi stop is about few hundred meters away, will take you to Centraal (train) station (10 euro), or Schipol Airport (40 euro). I had made the reservations using credit card. What I found out when we were leaving, they charge additional 5 % over total cost (hotel stay+5% city tax) for using a charge card. Hotel has multiple floors, but very narrow steep steps one needs to climb. Ask for lower floor if you have suitcases as it may be difficult to get up there. Continental breakfast is included in room price. A pot of coffee or tea, white / wheat bread for toasting, rolls, butter, jam, sliced cheese, etc.A table with couple of chairs in front of the building, where one can sit, smoke, have a cup of coffee while watching the passerby. A collection of longplay record covers are displayed on the walls of breakfast area, a working antique juke box has music choices from 60/70s. First quad room on third floor was quiet, looking at the back of the building, and small interior garden, offered clean bedding, but didnt have any soap or anything, or enough towels for four. Perhaps they forgot to replace. We had our own, so we didnt mind, and did not ask for it. Second quad room we used on the first floor looking at the street was much nicer. Everything we didnt have in the other quad room, was included in this room. Unfortunately in the second room, we couldn't fall asleep due to running or dripping water sounds of the radiators all night. Hotel is walking distance to everywhere one wants / needs to see in Amsterdam. Lots of trams running all day long as well. Weather was not as great while we were in Amsterdam. On again / off again drizzling rain most of the week. But it didnt stop us wondering through the city, sitting at the cafes in the center. September in Amsterdam is wet, one needs some warm clothes to protect from the wind/rain. Overall, I would recommend the place, good for groups / backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric and awesome”
Reviews.Author: nicolayh
Reviews.Content: When we entered the hotel, we are immediatly awestruck by the amazing atmosphere of the hotel, with posters of rock'n'roll legends hanging all over the place, and the various trinkets placed around the hotel. The manager was an amazing character himself, and in addition to giving us a 50% discount on the room we rented, he also showed us where we could park our car for only 6â‚¬ a day (inside Amsterdam ArenA)! The room was great, and even had it's own shower and toilet for only 75â‚¬ a night for three people. Though we spent little time in the room we all agreed that it was more than worth the money, and that we definatively would return to De Munck the next time we visited Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTraveller_07
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a couple of kilometers from the city centre of Amsterdam. It's in a beautiful neighbourhood, surrounded by canals and old canal houses. There are many nice restaurants nearby and it's easy to get to the city centre by a tram or by a bus. The room we got was probably (and hopefully) the smallest and dullest room of the hotel. It was in a small garden house, completely separated from the actual building. The privacy it gave us was ok, but the room was the smallest I've ever seen. It was difficult to fit two small pieces of luggage in the room. In addition to that, the room was VERY worn out and quite dirty. Also the bathroom was very shabby. The room was also very cold, and had a noisy (and suspiciously looking) external heater to keep the temperature decent. There was also another room in the garden house, but it seemed to be the hotel loundry... We had a quite cheap internet booking, so I'm not sure if that had something to do with the fact that we got such a small and shabby room. The other rooms seemed to be quite decent, at least in the pictures... Anyway, breakfast was quite nice and the breakfast room interestingly decorated in 50's and 60's rock'n'roll style. The staff was friendly and nice. As a whole the hotel is quite ok, as long as you don't get the room in the garden house.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SteveAnders
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed here in a quad and 2 triple rooms with private facilities. Absolutely no trouble at all. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and breakfast was not bad for continental. Anyone writing bad reviews for this hotel must have very high standards. What you have to remember is that it is 2 star. Afterall you get what you pay for and at 55 euros per person per night I have no complaints at all. Hotel is about 10 mins walk from most major sight seeing areas and is far enough away from the lively areas that the bars around it are about half the price of those in the very centre. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IrlandDiana
Reviews.Content: Different from the pictures in internet, the bedroon is ugly and dirty!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: sm6047
Reviews.Content: We rented the apartment rooms with another family and had a very nice three days in Amsterdam. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and it was so easy to walk everywhere or catch the tram. After 3 days in a very noisy Paris, this was a much needed stay on an extremely quiet street. Our family enjoyed breakfast and talking to Robert about his jukebox, as well as his feisty dog. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who will be visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Basil Fawlty 'lives'”
Reviews.Author: scrinch
Reviews.Content: Carmel & Ronan, Ireland. can't believe the reviews i've been reading about this glorified B&B trading as a hotel. Do some people like being ignored or treated like naughty schoolkids by their host? How can I sum up our host, first, Basil Fawlty was rude but funny, guess which one we missed out on, second, if you want to display your record collection in the 'dining area' then don't be surprised if people take a look them! We didn't, maybe that was because of the warning signs. Third, last weeks bread does not taste any better for being burnt at the communal toaster. I could go on, but this place was the pits, loved Amsterdam, but hated this dump.

Reviews.Title: “a warm,friendly and unique experience”
Reviews.Author: mikekan
Reviews.Content: I have just spend 3 days at the DE MUNCK hotel in Amsterdam. I can highly reccomend the hotel as it is good value for money. The manager , Robert , was always ready to help with any questions we had ranging from what to do, how to get there and where to eat. The Hotel is centrally situated in a central alley alongside a picturesque canal filled with house boats. From here its 10 minutes to most of the main squares, museums and fine restaurants. The heinekan factory is almost on the doorstep, so its easy to walk back to after your 3 free beers at the factory. The room was large, I mean large and even had a leather 3 piece sofa. Breakfast was fresh tasty and filling. We managed to get to dinner without being hungry. all in all - go there with an easy mind. You will not regret it. Mike

Reviews.Title: “A word of caution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 2 nights. It turns out they overbooked. We were given a room in a neighboring hotel the first night. It was not worth the money. The bathroom had leaks everywhere and was a complete mess. We had to move to another location about 0.5 mile away for the 2nd night. That room was quite nice. But we could not avail of the breakfast that is included because we had an early morning train to catch and Hotel de Munck was not on our way. Overall, it was a disappointing experience. It was not worth the money and was very inconvenient. The owner did not admit to overbooking or apologize for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “lovely familair hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Munck in Amsterdam is a really nice hotel on a quit place in the middle of the centrum, friendly owner, knows a lot about Amsterdam too and like to give you all the information you need. Hope to go to there soon again

Reviews.Title: “Beware de Munck”
Reviews.Author: DCsummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Munck in July 2005. We were there with a group of friends, and everyone we were with was unsatisfied with the hotel. We nicknamed it "Hotel de Junk" after the first night. The entire atmosphere was unprofessional and it felt much more like a bare-bones hostel than a hotel--which is fine, but it cost 100 euros per night. The man who runs the place was rude to everyone, including his wife. They did not deliver phone messages. The airline misplaced my suitcase and when they called to deliver it the man told them they could not as he would not be there to accept it. I had to wait an extra day to get the bag and he never left a message that they called. I requested an iron upon check-in and he yelled at me that he did not have one. Although later he brought one, it was too late to iron my clothes. There was no soap or shampoo in the rooms. The owner made nasty comments to my friend when she requested soap. Another friend requested that they turn the heat on in her room- it was in the 60s all weekend. He told her she needed to see a doctor if she was cold. We were woken up daily by the man yelling at his wife--he was NOT charming. The room overall was fine, but old furnishings and bathroom made it all seem dirty. Another thing- upon checkout they demand cash, but when I got home they charged my credit card 10 euros. When I emailed to ask what the 10 euros were for, they did not reply. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTaba2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice stay here in February. I think we got a bargain off-season rate. The accomodations (in the adjacent doorway, right next to the hotel) were clean and pleasant. The owner/manager was helpful, and breakfast was good if a bit crowded at certain times. The location is very good -- half a block from major tram lines, and many restaurants (from vegetarian to Tibetan) around the corner on Uterecht street.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sandcastles
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at Hotel de Munck and would definitely stay there again. It's hard to find family room-type accommodation in Europe and the price was good at EUR 160. Also, it felt quite homely. The four of us were in a large family room on the first floor overlooking the street and the nearby canal and the front door to the hotel. (I thought there might be a lot of noise but it was fine.) The room was nothing special but its size certainly helped and it was warm without being stuffy - not bad in late autumn. Power sockets already had an adaptor which was great. Coffee and hot chocolate were readily available courtesy of Rob, the manager, who was very personable and helpful. By the way, he looked at our passports but didn't keep them! I only have three little things to mention to prospective guests: it is an old building so, yes, stairs are steep and narrow. There are no non-smoking rooms but windows can be opened. I had forgotton about the need to pay in cash so that entailed a dash to the nearest ATM which is basically a block away - I would have appreciated a reminder about the cash payment on check-in. These are all relatively minor things, and we had a great 24 hours. Utrechtstraat, five mins away, has great choice of restaurants - try Suizer, the Swiss restaurant, for fabulous comfort food on a winter's night.

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for us and our three children (ages 16, 12 and 9)! We had a large room (No. 3) overlooking the garden, with five single beds - a hard find anywhere in Europe - at a cost of 190 euros/night (included breakfast). We had a good sized bathroom with toilet, sink and shower. The room and bath were immaculate. The room also had a TV, hairdryer and mini-bar (the mini-bar was empty which suited us well as we stored our water and juices in it). Lots of fluffy white towels, soap and shampoo. The location couldn't be better...a lovely quiet area across the street from a park, complete with sidewalk trampolines which we couldn't tear our 9 yr old away from, and only a few blocks away from shops and restaurants. The owners were very friendly and helpful and served a great breakfast including juice, sweetbreads, sliced meat, cheese, cereals, boiled eggs, bread for toasting, a large pot of delicious coffee, and hot chocolate for the kids. Check out the pictures at ------------------------------------especially those of the electic eating area! A great place to stay and very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the room in the garden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Extremely private without any noise or bother from any one else at the hotel. Sorry to hear it was temporary because I would have loved to stay in that room again. The mngt is amazingly friendly and helpful and the atosphere of the dining area is also great- fun and cozy. I recommend this hotel to everyone visiting amsterdam. What a beautiful and quiet block to reside.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel, plenty of charm and we were given a great room on the third floor, i think it was room number 17 (but i could be worng) The tv worked, the rooms were clean and we had a LARGE bathroom. The breakfast was good (a little different that what i normally eat in the US, but thats why i went to europe to see how others live) The stairs are steeep, and there is no lift, but this is common in europe. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood, and the owners are soo nice and speak perfect english. They were always willing to answer my questions and give me tips.

Reviews.Title: “Internet special room”
Reviews.Author: chic2011
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find our room was in the 'garden'. Turned out it was a temporary sort of building/shed. It was tiny-finding room,not in the way, for 2 carry-on bags was impossible. When I questioned this the mgt was OK. Told me that they would be happy to call around for us to get another room or to change ours on the 4th and last day for a higher charge. This room was posted at E95. I was given an 'internet special' price of E75. I pointed out that it was the same price as their other rooms with private baths. We were changed to a hotel room on the last nite at no additional charge. The breakfast is good with atmospheric surroundings, mgt friendly. Our final room was what I had been expecting from the web photos-old with character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RJStrand
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. It worked well for me as many of my friends live in the city center. Good breakfast, great hosts, nice room. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Amsterdam a few days ago, and I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The building itself is charming, so are the owners. It is located within the center, on a calm canal and has rooms for 4 people, an interesting feature.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond our expectations ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation. Quiet location, yet within walking distance of all the areas of Old Amsterdam.Rob & Hanneke were super hosts. Anything that was asked for, by a family of seven, was attended to immediately and with a smile.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Munck
HotelInfo.Address: Achtergracht 3, Amsterdam 1017 WL, The Netherlands
